data.name: Operation - Steal the Election!
data.description:
Honald Chump is in trouble. He is behind Dillary Tilton in the polls and can't keep his foot out of his mouth. Tuesday November 8 is quickly approaching, so it is time for an alternate political strategy - hack the election! Honald has hired you to hack into the voting systems in a few key states and alter the results, but without being detected. Lucky for you budget cuts mean the voting machines purchased were, well, poorly designed. The voting machine has a simple checksum-like method for security. When a voter chooses a candidate three things happen:
  1. The first letter of the candidates last name gets added to an array.
  2. The vote count is incremented
  3. The character code of the first letter of the last name is added to the previous checksum value. Then that value is divided by a secret key with the remainder being stored as the new checksum.

After the election is over the Elections Department counts the values in the array in #1 to see who won as well to ensure the count and checksum matches.

The developers of this code accidently put the code that generates the "secret key" on GitHub. It appears to be based on the date of the election.
var secret_key = (monthOfElectionIndex * dayOfElectionIndex) - dayOfWeekOfElectionIndex
Where January has a month index of 1 and Sunday has a day of week index of 1.

Other hackers working for Chump have infliltrated the network and can intercept the array from #1 above. Your job is to alter that array in such a way as to both ensure Chump wins and that the values from #2 and #3 are maintained so as to keep the pesky media at bay.
